page.title: 013 SOUTH NORTHANTS VILLAGES
page.content: This block covers some woodland, fertile farming land and mainly grain, but some mixed farming. Many of the dwellings are local ironstone, the three villages are linked under the care of one rector each have their own church, Parish Council and Parish Church Council. Several small family farms employ few full time workers, one large grain farm is highly mechanised. A small amount of part time, mainly domestic work, is provided. Most villagers commute to nearby towns, some go as far as London. Many cottages have been combined to make pleasant modern homes. There is a small industrial estate at Hitchborough, within the garden centre is a long established pipe factory. The villages are allowed only infilling buildings this retaining a precious area of land,
